smell.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose
smell.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The air was filled with the smell of flowers.
smell.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I think the smell’s getting worse.
smell.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the ability to notice or recognize smells
smell.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Dogs have a very good sense of smell.
smell.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Have a smell of this cheese; does it seem all right?
smell.translation[0].note_box[0].section: There was a strong smell of burning in the air.
faint
I noticed a faint smell of perfume.
overpowering
The smell of disinfectant was overpowering.
nice/pleasant/lovely
There was a lovely smell of fresh coffee.
bad/unpleasant/horrible etc
The smell in the shed was awful.
a strange/funny/odd smell
What’s that funny smell?
a sweet smell
She liked the sweet smell of hay in the barn.
a delicious smell
There were delicious smells emanating from the kitchen.
a sickly smell
the sweet, sickly smell of decaying human flesh
a pungent smell
A pungent smell of garlic filled the air.
an acrid smell
The acrid smell of smoke clung about the place.
a musty/stale/sour smell
The clothes in the wardrobe had a damp musty smell.
have a strong/sweet etc smell
The flowers had a lovely sweet smell.
be filled with a smell
The house was filled with the smell of baking bread.
give off a smell
Rubber gives off a strong smell when it is burned.
notice/smell a smell
He detected a faint smell of blood.
a smell comes from somewhere
A delicious smell of baking came from the kitchen.
He was getting complaints about the smell emanating from his shop.
a smell wafts somewhere
The smells wafting up the stairs from the kitchen were making her feel hungry.
smell.translation[0].note_box[1].section: smell
something that you can recognize by breathing in through your nose
the smell from the kitchen
What’s that awful smell?
the sweet smell of roses
whiff
something that you smell for a short time
He caught a whiff of her perfume.
a whiff of apple blossom
scent
a smell – used especially about the pleasant smell from flowers, plants, or fruit. Also used about the smell left by an animal
The rose had a beautiful scent.
Cats use their scent to mark their territory.
the sharp, dying scent of autumn
the heady scent  (=strong scent)of magnolias
fragrance/perfume
a pleasant smell, especially from flowers, plants, or fruit. Fragrance and perfume are more formal than scent
the sweet perfume of the orange blossoms
Each mango has its own special fragrance.
aroma
a pleasant smell from food or coffee
the aroma of fresh coffee
The kitchen was filled with the aroma of mince pies.
odour
an unpleasant smell
An unpleasant odour was coming from the dustbins.
the odor of stale tobacco smoke
pong
an unpleasant smell
What’s that horrible pong?
stink/stench
a very strong and unpleasant smell
I couldn’t get rid of the stink of sweat.
The toilet gave off a terrible stench.
smell.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to notice or recognize a particular smell
smell.translation[1].definitions[1].note: Smell is a linking verb in this meaning It links the subject of the sentence with an adjective
The cream smells funny  (=it has a strange smell)
smell.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The room smelled to high heaven (=had a very bad smell).
smell.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to put your nose near something in order to discover what kind of smell it has
smell.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: She bent down and smelt the flowers.
smell.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to have the ability to notice and recognize smells
smell.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: I’ve got a cold and I can’t smell.
smell.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: to have a particular smell
smell.translation[1].note_box[0].section: Rub your chopping board with lemon to keep it smelling fresh.
A ripe melon will smell sweet.
Cigarettes make your clothes smell awful.
The man smelled strongly of alcohol.
His suit smelled faintly of tobacco.
smell.translation[1].note_box[1].items[0: The verb smell is not usually used in the progressive You say
smell.translation[1].note_box[1].items[1: You often say someone can smell something when describing what they smell
smell.translation[1].note_box[1].items[2: The present participle smelling  is used to form adjectives such as sweet-smelling and foul-smelling
